intro: Nothites baccharidea, commonly known as the coastal shrub, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in dune environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes. Nothites baccharidea is adapted to saline and wind-prone conditions, making it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
